tag_professor: Respected (3)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Caring (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: This was one of the most interesting classes that I have taken at UC Berkeley. It gives a good overview on biomechanics. Professor Li is very helpful and explains the concepts well. Tests are pretty straightforward and fair, and the group projects are interesting. I definitely would recommend this class!

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Caring (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: BioE 102 provides a good introduction to biomechanics, and is a great class only hampered by a somewhat messy book. Song Li is a thoughtful professor and a clear lecturer, and you can tell that he cares about both the subject and his students.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Caring (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Professor Song is a quality professor. His lectures cover the material well and he is open to questions. On his midterm and final, he is very fair with the questions and never asks you to answer questions on material not covered.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Caring (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: I have taken both BioE 102 and BioE 116 with Professor Li. He is friendly and receptive to students during office hours, and lectures provide good notes to prepare for problem sets and exams. The group projects are enjoyable and provide an opportunity to solidify your understanding of concepts.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Caring (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Professor Li is a very enjoyable professor who is clear and makes classes entertaining. He is always available to help his students. The BioE 102 class was very interesting and I enjoyed how the class was set up. The group project gave good opportunity to learn. I would definitely recommend the class to anyone.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Caring (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: class is pure memorization of EVERYTHING he says in class. no real teaching in classes, just skim over everything on the slide. you really have to take the time to learn everything on your own.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Caring (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: His lecture style is very unorganized and not very conducive to learning the material.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Caring (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Honestly, an extremely helpful professors who is very approachable when it comes to answering your questions. He tries to teach the class, although his accent may get in the way. Overall, a 4 out 5 prof.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Caring (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: guys! the dude before me sucks-all lies. Dr. Li is very helpful he cares about his students, asks and remembers any detail u tell him! he writes rec letters trutfully.I enjoyed his classes and never thought they were boring. If you attend the lectures, no texbook is required! you learn what u need to learn! He is my favorite BE professor!

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Caring (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: His tests are easy and the lecture material is pretty easy. However, as a lecturer he is pretty boring and goes over a lot of unnecessary proofs in class. As a professor, he is difficult to talk to and he doesn\'t care much about undergraduates. His office hours are completely useless.Never ask him to write a rec letter.
